H0.text: Galaxies are the biggest groups of stars.

H1.text: Cells are the biggest groups of stars.

H2.text: Novas are the biggest groups of stars called.

H3.text: Orbits are the biggest groups of stars called.

A4.text: The largest galaxies are the type-cD galaxies. First described in 1964 by a paper by Thomas A. Matthews and others, they are a subtype of the more general class of D galaxies, which are giant elliptical galaxies, except that they are much larger.

A5.text: Galaxies, averaging an estimated 100 million stars, range in size from dwarfs with less than a thousand stars, to the largest galaxies known â€“ supergiants with one hundred trillion stars, each orbiting its galaxy's centre of mass.
